member.name: T:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLStation
member.summary: Binding with the component, XML Station is used to perform the telephony operations on a voice station and manage the calls associated with it.
member.remarks:
Binding with the component, XML Station monitors the voice station specified by the property. Comparing with the , it provides the objects on a layer higher than the XML and CSTAT tier. The objects exposed by ASXMLStation preserve the active calls on the voice station and allow users to manipulate calls through a set of methods at the call appearance level.
Thread Safety: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.
If any instance member is invoked from a thread that is different from the one the event of the underlying XMLClient fires, synchronization is required to provide thread safe operation. For instance, if the CallDial method is invoked from a separate thread, the following synchronization lock needs to add to the code block:
//For C#:
lock(asxmlStation1) asxmlStation1.CallDial("8576", "");
'For VB:
SyncLock AsxmlStation1
AsxmlStation1.CallDial("8576","")
End SyncLock
Call Control MethodsDescription
Answers the alterting call on the voice station.
Performs the conference call operation on the current active call of the voice station.
Places a new call on the voice station.
Diverts (deflects) the alerting incoming call on the voice station to the divertDN.
Holds the active call on the voice station.
Drops a call party associatedwith the active call on the voice station.
Releases all connections associated with the call on the voice station.
Generates DTMF digits tones for the active call on the voice station.
Performs the transfer call operation on the current active call of the voice station.
Retrieves the held call on the voice station and makes it active.
Answers the alterting call or unholds the held call on the specified call appearance of the voice station.
Gets the call based on the call appearance.
Gets the call based on the call ID.
Gets the first call based on the call state.
Call Control EventsDescription
Fires when the call associated with the current voice station is modified.
Fires when the busy state of the voice station changes.
Agent Control MethodsDescription
Gets the state of the gent logged in on the voice station.
Logs in/out an agent on the voice station and changes the agent state.
Agent Control EventsDescription
Fires when launching the method successully.
Device Feature Control MethodsDescription
Queries the Do Not Disturb feature status at the voice station.
Queries the Forwarding feature status at the voice station.
Queries the message waiting feature status at the voice station.
Controls the Do Not Disturb feature at the voice station.
Controls the Forwarding feature at the voice station.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.IStationCallMethod.CallRelease
member.summary: Releases all connections associated with the first call found on the voice station.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
It drops all the members of an established conference call.
If there are multi calls on the voice station, it identifies the releasing call based on the call state in the following order:
1. The active call.
2. The first failed call found
3. The first held call found

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.IStationCallMethod.CallTransfer(AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.enTransferType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs the transfer call operation on the current active call of the voice station.
member.param:
Specify the destination number the call will be transferred to.
It applies when the TransferType is BlindTransfer or StartConsult and will be ingored when TransferType is set to other values.
Specify the type of transfer operation to be undertaken.

Specify the user to user information which is attached with the transferring call.
It applies when the TransferType is BlindTransfer or StartConsult and will be ingored when TransferType equals to other values.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
It supports two types of transfer operation: blind transfer and consult transfer.
For the blind transfer, the component automatically completes the transfer operation when the transfer consulted call is placed successfully. Users do not need to invoke other methods to complete it.
In the consult transfer, the component does not complete it automatically. Application needs to complete or cancel the pending tranfer by invoking the "CompleteConsult" CallTransfer or "CancelConsult" CallTransfer.
"CompleteConsult" CallTransfer operation needs either the secondary transfer pending call or the primary transfer pending call to be the current active call. It returns an error if both of them are in held state.
"AbortConsult" CallTransfer needs the secondary transfer pending call to be the current active call, or it returns an error to indicate the operation failed.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.IStationCallMethod.CallConference(AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.enConferenceType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs the conference call operation on the current active call of the voice station.
member.param:
Specify the destination number the call will be setup a conference with.
It applies when the ConferenceType is BlindConference or StartConsult and will be ingored when ConferenceType is set to other values.
Specify the type of the Conference operation to be undertaken.

Specify the user to user information which is attached with the conference call.
It applies when the ConferenceType is BlindConference or StartConsult and will be ingored when ConferenceType equals to other values.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
It supports two types of conference operation: blind conference and consult conference.
For the blind conference, the component automatically completes the conference operation when the conference consulted call is placed successfully. Users do not need to invoke other methods to complete it.
In the consult conference, the component does not complete it automatically. Application needs to complete or cancel the pending conference by invoking the "CompleteConsult" CallConference or "CancelConsult" CallConference.
"CompleteConsult" CallConference operation needs either the secondary conference pending call or the primary conference pending call to be the current active call. It returns an error if both of them are in held state.
"AbortConsult" CallConference needs the secondary conference pending call to be the current active call, or it returns an error to indicate the operation failed.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.IStationAgentMethod.AgentSetState(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.enReqAgentState,System.String,System.String,System.String,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.PrivateData.enWorkMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the agent state for the agent logged in to the specified split on the voice station. Used for Non Expert Agent Selection (Non-EAS) situations.
member.param: Specify the requested agent state the agent will be set to.
Specify the Agent ID used when the agent logs in or logs out. It is ignored when setting the agent to ohter states.
Specify the agent password used when the agent logs in or logs out. It is ignored when setting the agent to ohter states.
Specify the split extension number the agent is logged in. Only for Non-EAS situation.
Specifies the agent work mode as defined by the DEFINITY PBX.
Specifies the reason code for the appropriate agent state. Validate reason codes are a single digit 1-9. A value of 0 indicates that the reason code is not available.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
If an agent is in logged out sate, users need to firstly log agent in, by invoking the method with "loggedOn" request state, before setting the agent state to other states e.g. "ready".
The method is invoked by the component if the "AgentSetState" is launched successfully, which will fire the event to indicate the latest agent state or agent pending state.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.IStationFeatureMethod.SetDoNotDisturb(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls the do not disturb feature at the voice station.
member.param:
Specifies whether the do not disturb feature is enabled. The complete set of possible values is:
• FALSE- Do not disturb feature is not enabled.
• TRUE- Do not disturb feature is enabled.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
The ASXMLStation component does not return a positive response event for this method directly.
If it is invoked successfully, the method will be launched by the component automatically, which will fire the event to notify the application the latest status.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLStation.CallTransfer(AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.enTransferType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs the transfer call operation on the current active call of the voice station.
member.param:
Specify the destination number the call will be transferred to.
It applies when the TransferType is BlindTransfer or StartConsult and will be ingored when TransferType is set to other values.
Specify the type of transfer operation to be undertaken.

Specify the user to user information (UUI) which is attached with the transferring call.
It applies when the TransferType is BlindTransfer or StartConsult and will be ingored when TransferType equals to other values.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
It supports two types of transfer operation: blind transfer and consult transfer.
For the blind transfer, the component automatically completes the transfer operation when the transfer consulted call is placed successfully. Users do not need to invoke other methods to complete it.
In the consult transfer, the component does not complete it automatically. Application needs to complete or cancel the pending tranfer by invoking the "CompleteConsult" CallTransfer or "CancelConsult" CallTransfer.
"CompleteConsult" CallTransfer operation needs either the secondary transfer pending call or the primary transfer pending call to be the current active call. It returns an error if both of them are in held state.
"AbortConsult" CallTransfer needs the secondary transfer pending call to be the current active call, or it returns an error to indicate the operation failed.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLStation.CallConference(AgileSoftware.Developer.Station.enConferenceType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs the conference call operation on the current active call of the voice station.
member.param:
Specify the destination number the call will be setup a conference with.
It applies when the ConferenceType is BlindConference or StartConsult and will be ingored when ConferenceType is set to other values.
Specify the type of the Conference operation to be undertaken.

Specify the user to user information (UUI) which is attached with the conference call.
It applies when the ConferenceType is BlindConference or StartConsult and will be ingored when ConferenceType equals to other values.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
It supports two types of conference operation: blind conference and consult conference.
For the blind conference, the component automatically completes the conference operation when the conference consulted call is placed successfully. Users do not need to invoke other methods to complete it.
In the consult conference, the component does not complete it automatically. Application needs to complete or cancel the pending conference by invoking the "CompleteConsult" CallConference or "CancelConsult" CallConference.
"CompleteConsult" CallConference operation needs either the secondary conference pending call or the primary conference pending call to be the current active call. It returns an error if both of them are in held state.
"AbortConsult" CallConference needs the secondary conference pending call to be the current active call, or it returns an error to indicate the operation failed.

member.remarks:
It provides the similar operation as clicking a call appearance button on a handset:

2. Unholds the held call if there is one on the call appearance.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.

member.summary: Set the agent state for the agent logged in to the specified split on the voice station. Used for Non Expert Agent Selection (Non-EAS) situations.
member.param: Specify the requested agent state the agent will be set to.
Specify the Agent ID used when the agent logs in or logs out. It is ignored when setting the agent to ohter states.
Specify the agent password used when the agent logs in or logs out. It is ignored when setting the agent to ohter states.
Specify the split extension number the agent is logged in. Only for Non-EAS situation.
Specifies the agent work mode as defined by the DEFINITY PBX.
Specifies the reason code for the appropriate agent state. Validate reason codes are a single digit 1-9. A value of 0 indicates that the reason code is not available.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
member.remarks:
If an agent is in logged out sate, users need to firstly log agent in, by invoking the method with "loggedOn" request state, before setting the agent state to other states e.g. "ready".
The method is invoked by the component if the "AgentSetState" is launched successfully, which will fire the event to indicate the latest agent state or agent pending state.

member.name: P:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLStation.AutoPollingMSWIndicator

Set its value to false to reduce the network trafic and server overhead. Set its value to true only when the Message Waiting Indicator could be set through other ways than invoking the method e.g. a message left in the voice message box of the voice station.
The polling speed depends on the value of property.

member.name: P:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLStation.AutoPollingForwarding
member.summary: Gets or sets if the component automatically invokes the method to request the latest "Call Forwarding" status of the voice station.
member.remarks:
Set its value to false to reduce the network trafic and server overhead. Set its value to true only when the "Call Forwarding" could be set through other ways than invoking the method e.g. users use the handset to change the status.
The polling speed depends on the value of property.

member.name: P:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLStation.PollingFeatureInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval in seconds at which the component polls the the Do Not Disturb, Message Waiting Indicator and Call Forwarding status.
member.remarks: Its value is in the range between 5 seconds and 600 seconds. The component only polls a particular feature when its relevant "AutoPolling" property is set to "True".

member.name: P:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLStation.PreserveCallEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets if the component maintains the call event history associated with a StationCall.

To reduce the usage of the system resource, set its value to "false" under the situation when the application does not need the call events history to retrieve any call information.

member.name: T:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient
member.summary: ASXMLClient is the client component for communicating with the Active XML Server.
member.remarks:
The XML Client works as the client-side component to communicate with the Active XML Server. It allows users to perform telephony operations through the services and events defined in "XML Protocol for Computer Supported Telecommunications Applications (CSTA) Phase III" (Standard ECMA-323) by exposing two tiers of functionalities: XML tier and CSTA tier.
You can use its exposed members to implement telephony operations directly, or, in a simpler way, treat it as a "data source" of the , and components to achieve the same purposes by binding those higher level components to the XMLClient. It is suggested that you use the second approach if possible, especially when building a soft-phone application to control desktop voice stations.
Thread Safety: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.
Notes: Please make sure to invoke the ASXMLClient Dispose when an application using it needs to be closed. Failing doing that may cause the application not to be shut down completely.
XML Tier: Working as the base tier, the interface of the XML layer includes the methods and events to communcate with the XML server directly in the XML format of data. Under this tier, users can validate and send a customised XML request to the server or receive a server response event by using the following methods or events:
XML MethodsDescription
Performs the schema validation on the XML document and sends it to the Active XML Server.
Validates the specified XML document text against the CSTA III schemas.
Invokes an asynchronous subroutine to load the CSTA III schemas.
Unload the CSTA schemas and release the resource used by the schemas.
XML EventsDescription
Fires when a response message is returned from the Active XML Server.
Fires when the method completes and the CSTA schemas have been loaded into the memory.
CSTA Tier: The CSTA tier interface includes the the services and responses defined in the "XML Protocol for Computer Supported Telecommunications Applications (CSTA) Phase III" (Standard ECMA-323) and "Services for Computer Supported Telecommunications Applications (CSTA) Phase III" (Standard ECMA-269). You can perform the telephony operations by using the methods and events included in this layer without building or validating the XML document. A set of CSTA methods and events are listed below.
Monitoring Services (Methods)DescriptionPositive Response
Starts monitoring a device object or call object.
Cancels a previously initiated Monitor Start service.
Modifies the set of event reports that are filtered out (not sent) over an existing monitor.
Snapshot Services (Methods)DescriptionPositive Response
Provides information about the devices participating in a specified call.
Cancels a previously initiated Monitor Start service.
Error EventDescription
Fires when a CSTA error is reported by the server. Its argument includes the CSTA error descriptions.
Call Control Services (Methods)DescriptionPositive Response
Places an existing active call on hold and then retrieves a previously held call.
Connects an alerting or queued call.
Releases all devices from an existing call.
Releases a specific device from a call.
Conferences of an existing held call and another active call at a conferencing device.
Places an existing active call at a device on hold and initiates a new call from the same device.
Diverts a call to another destination that may be inside or outside the switching sub-domain.
Allows the computing function to perform a dialling sequence that is associated with a call that has already been initiated.
Places a active call connection on hold at the same device.
Sets up a call between a calling device and a called device.
Originates a call between two devices by first creating a connection to the called device.
Connects a specified held connection.
Joins a new device into an existing call.
Transfers an existing active call connection at a device to another device.
Transfers a call held at a device to an active call at the same device.
Call Control EventsDescription
Fires when a call has been cleared and no longer exists within the switching sub-domain. Only provided for calls that are being call-type monitored.
Fires when the conferencing device has conferenced itself or another device with an existing call and when no devices have been removed from the resulting call.
Fires when a single device has disconnected or dropped out of a call.
Fires when a call is being presented to a device in either the Ringing or Entering Distribution modes of the alerting state.
Fires when a call has been diverted from a device and when the call is no longer present at the device.
Fires when a call has been answered at a device or when a call has been connected to a device.
Fires when a call cannot be completed or a connection has entered the Fail state.
Fires when a call has been placed on hold.
Fires when a call has cut through the switching sub-domain boundary to another network; that is, has reached and engaged a Network Interface Device (e.g., trunk, CO Line).
Fires when a call is being attempted from a device. It implies that input activity for the call is complete and that a call (rather than a feature) has been requested.
Fires when a call has been queued.
Fires when a previously held call has been retrieved.
Fires when a telephony service has been initiated at a monitored device.
Fires when an existing call has been transferred to another device and the transferring device has been dropped from the call.
Call Associated Services (Methods)DescriptionPositive Response
Causes a series of digits to be sent on behalf of a connection in a call.
Physical Device Services (Methods)DescriptionPositive Response
Provides the message waiting feature status at a specified device.
Controls the status of the message waiting feature at a specified device.
Query the device name.
Physical Device EventsDescription
Fires when the message waiting status has been changed for a device.
Logical Device Services (Methods)DescriptionPositive Response
Provides the agent state at a specified device.
Requests a new agent state at a specified device.
Provides the Do Not Disturb feature status at a specified device.
Provides the Forwarding feature status at a specified device.
Allows the application to control the Do Not Disturb feature at a specified device.
Allows the application to control the Forwarding feature at a specified device.
Logical Device EventsDescription
Fires when an agent has entered the Busy state.
Fires when an agent has logged off an ACD device or an ACD group.
Fires when an agent is logged-on at a particular device to an ACD device or ACD group and is ready to contribute to the activities of the ACD device or ACD group.
Fires when an agent has entered the Agent Not Ready state.
Fires when an agent has entered the Ready state.
Fires when an agent has entered the Working After Call state.
Routing Services (Methods)DescriptionPositive Response
Registers the application function as a routing server for a specific routing device or as a routing server for all routing devices within the switching sub-domain.
Cancels a previous route registration.
Ends a routing dialogue.N/A
Provides the destination requested by a previous event.N/A
Routing EventsDescription
Fires when the server asynchronously cancels an active routing registration. It invalidates a current routing registration.
Fires when a routing dialogue is ended.
Fires by the server to request the routing application to provide a destination for a call.
Fires by the server to provide the actual destination for a call that has been routed using the Route Select service with its optional parameter that requests the route that was used.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.Connect
member.summary: Connects to the Active XML Server using naming service.
member.remarks:
Invokes this method to connect to the XML server after the the , and properties have been specified with valid values. It connects to XML Server to receive a list of real IP Address/Port combinations that can be used to establish the the real TServer connection under the specified TServer link name. This one should be called before using other methods. The event and event will fire if connecting to the XML Server and TServer successfully.
The component automatically invokes this method when it is instantiated if the property is set to true at design mode.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.Connect(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Establishes an Avaya CT stream through the Active XML Server directly without using the name service.
member.remarks:
Working as an alternative to connecting to TServer using name service, it connects to XML Server to establish an Avaya CT stream directly based on the specified TServer IP and TServer port value.
It can be only used when the AXMLSClientIP and AXMLSClientPort settings of the XML Server are specified as static values rather then the values dynamically obtained from the operation system.
The event and event will fire if connecting to the XML Server and TServer successfully.
member.param: The real IP which will be used to establish the Avaya CT stream connection.
The real port which will be used to establish the Avaya CT stream connection.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.XMLSendRequest(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends the XML request to the Active XML Server.
member.remarks:
Sends the XML request message to the XML server. The XMLRequest is an XML document text that should meet the requriment of the ECMA CSTA III protocol.
If NeedsValidating = true, the component invokes the method to validate the XML document against the CSTA III schemas before sending it to the server. If the document is invalid, it will not be sent to the server and the method returns an integer value 5 which can be casted to the "InvalidXMLDocument" of the enumeration .
Please reference to "XML Protocol for Computer Supported Telecommunications Applications (CSTA) Phase III" for more details.
member.param: XML document text that is validated against the ECMA CSTA III schemas.
True if the XML domcument needs to be validated against the CSTA schemas. Set it to true when returns true. False if the XML document does not need to do the validation.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID. If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.XMLBeginLoadCSTASchemas(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invokes an asynchronous subroutine to load the CSTA III schemas.
member.param: Recommend set it to false to avoid the extra overhead for reloading all the schema files to the default directory ("Schema_CSTA3" under the current working directory). Set its value to true only when you want all the CSTA III schema files to be reloaded from the assembly to the default directory and overwrite the existing ones. Depends on the PC resource, the whole overwriting process may take a couple of minutes to complete.
member.remarks:
It extracts the CSTA III schema files stored in the assembly to the "Schema_CSTA3" subdirectory under the current working directory and loads them into the memory.
This method needs to be called explicitly or implicitly before calling the method or assign a true value to the "NeedsValidating" argument of the method.
If the property is set to true this method will be called automatically (with OverwriteExistingSchemas = false) when the component is stantiated.
event will fires and returns true when loading the schemas completed.
To avoid using extra memory resource, only calls it when there are XML documents need to be validated. If necessary, call the method to unload the schemas and release the resource.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.XMLBeginLoadCSTASchemas(System.String)
member.summary: Invokes an asynchronous subroutine to load the CSTA III schemas.
member.param: The full path of the directory that stores the CSTA schemas.
member.remarks:
It loads the CSTA schemas from the specified directory into the memory directly without extracting schema files from the assembly. It allows the users to load the CSTA shcemas from the specified diretory, under where the users can store the customised schemas. In this scenario, the CSTA schemas files should be stored in the specified directory in advance.
This method needs to be called explicitly or implicitly before calling the method or specify a true value to the "NeedsValidating" argument of the method.
event will fires and returns true when loading the schemas completed.
To avoid using extra memory resource, only calls it when there are XML documents need to be validated. If necessary, call the method to unload the schemas and release the resource.

member.remarks:
Validates the XMLText againt the CSTA schemas which have been loaded into the memory.
CSTA III schemas need to be loaded before using this method. To load the schemas, set the property to true at design mode or calls the method at run time.
member.param: The XML document text that will be validated.
Returns the error message if this XMLText is invalid against the CSTA schemas.
member.returns: Ture if the XMLText is valid. False if the XMLText is invalid or the schemas have not been loaded yet ( property returns false).

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAMonitorStart(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.enMonitorType,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAMonitorFilter)
member.summary: Start monitor a call object.
member.param: The existing call that the monitor will be placed on. Normally it is presented in the call related response events.

Indicates a monitor type when starting a monitor.
Call-type: is used to track an existing call, for as long as that call remains in the switching sub-domain. Monitor Stop Response is fired when the call ceases to exist in the switching sub-domain to indicate that the monitor is stopped and the associated Monitor Cross Reference Identifier is no longer valid.
Device-type: is used to track an existing call, while that call remains at the specified device. Monitor Stop response is fired when the call leaves the device to indicate that the monitor is stopped and the associated Monitor Cross Reference Identifier is no longer valid. No supported for this version.

Indicates which events will be filtered out when starting a monitor. No events will be filtered if a null or nothing is assigned to it. It is presented as the RequestMonitorFilter property of the object.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID which is presented as the InvokeID property of the object. If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
Initiates event reports for a call, device, or for one or more calls involving a device.
The server starts a monitor, allocates a Monitor Cross Reference Identifier that uniquely identifies the monitor, and then positively acknowledges the request. All activities satisfying the filter provided (for example: call, feature, agent, private) trigger events which are delivered as a stream of event reports to the server. Each event contains the Monitor Cross Reference Identifier that correlates the event back to the Monitor Start service that established the monitor.
These event reports cease after the monitor is terminated by the server or invoking the CSTAMonitorStop method. Once the monitor is terminated, the monitor cross reference ID is no longer valid.
Two types of monitor can be placed on a monitor object: Call-type and Device-type.
Call-type: The call continues to be monitored as long as it remains in the switching sub-domain.
For example, if a call that is being call-type monitored is transferred to another device in the switching sub-domain, the call will continue to be monitored. The application receives events for all devices in the call until the call ceases to exist or until it leaves the switching sub-domain. The Diverted event is an exception. The switching function (as indicated through the capabilities exchange services) may or may not be providing Diverted events to all devices in a call.
For call-type monitors:
When a device ceases to participate in a call, and the call is transferred or forwarded to another device, subsequent events at the new device are reported. The Monitor Cross Reference Identifier used in events at the new device will be the same one used before the call was forwarded or transferred.
If a call is being monitored using a call-type monitor and one of the devices consults to another device (i.e. a new call is created), then the computing function will not see events for the secondary call (new consultation call) until either the primary call is transferred to the consulted device, or until the two calls are conferenced together.
A call that is being monitored may have a new Call Identifier assigned to it after a conference or transfer. The call related events report the new Call Identifier in a Conferenced or Transferred event.
Device-type: The call does not continue to be monitored after the call leaves the device.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAMonitorStart(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTADeviceID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.enMonitorType,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAMonitorFilter,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.enMonitorDeivceType)
member.summary: Start monitor a device object. A object will be added into the if monitor successfully.
member.param: The device that the monitor will be placed on.

Indicates a monitor type when starting a monitor.
Call-type: is used to track a particular existing call, for as long as that call remains in the switching sub-domain. No supported for this version.
Device-type: is used to track all the calls while they still remain at the specified device.

Indicates which events will be filtered out when starting a monitor. No events will be filtered if a null or nothing is assigned to it. It is presented as the RequestMonitorFilter property of the object.

Indicates a monitor device type.
Desktop: It indicates monitor device type is either CC Elite Multichannel Reporting or CC Elite Multichannel Desktop.
Other : It indicates monitor device type other than CC Elite Multichannel Reporting and CC Elite Multichannel Desktop.
member.returns: Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID which is presented as the InvokeID property of the object. If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
Initiates event reports for a call, device, or for one or more calls involving a device.
The server starts a monitor, allocates a Monitor Cross Reference Identifier that uniquely identifies the monitor, and then positively acknowledges the request. All activities satisfying the filter provided (for example: call, feature, agent, private) trigger events which are delivered as a stream of event reports to the server. Each event contains the Monitor Cross Reference Identifier that correlates the event back to the Monitor Start service that established the monitor.
These event reports cease after the monitor is terminated by the server or invoking the CSTAMonitorStop method. Once the monitor is terminated, the monitor cross reference ID is no longer valid.
A object will be added into the if monitor successfully.
Two types of monitor can be placed on a monitor object: Call-type and Device-type.
Call-type: This combination is used to track all calls that arrive (or are present) at the device, for as long as the calls remain in the switching sub-domain.
The specified device object can be thought of as a trigger device where all calls that become involved with this device become monitored as long as the call remains in the switching subdomain.
Monitor Stop response is not fired when a call ceases to exist or moves away from the monitored device, since the monitor is still in place at the device.
Device-type: This combination is used to track all calls that arrive (or are present) at the device, for as long as the calls remains at the device.
Monitor Stop response is not fired when a call ceases to exist or moves away from the monitored device, since the monitor is still in place at the device.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAAlternateCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID)
member.summary: Places an existing active call on hold and then retrieves a previously held call.
member.param: The held connection for the alternating device.
The active connection for the alternating device.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
This service is also used to place an active call on hold and then connect to an alerting or queued call at the same device (i.e., to answer a call-waiting call).
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (activeCall)ConnectedHold
D1C2 (heldCall)D1C2 (heldCall) Hold, Alerting, or QueuedConnected
other connections (i.e., D2C1, D3C2)(Unspecified)(Unaffected; no transition due to this service).
Event Sequences: Case A: Call C2 is on Hold at device D1 (Alternating Device)
Case B: Call C2 is Alerting or Queued at device D1 (Alternating Device)
Functional Requirements: 1. The Alternate Call service shall not be used to put an alerting call on hold and re-connect to another call that is on hold.
2. This service is a multiple step service that is equivalent to the computing function issuing the Hold Call service for the activeCall ConnectionID and then issuing one of the following services:
a. a Retrieve Call service for the heldCall ConnectionID.
b. an Answer Call service for the heldCall ConnectionID.
c. an Accept Call service for the heldCall ConnectionID.
3. The consultOptions parameter indicates the potential action following the Alternate Call service so that certain facilities can be allocated if a transfer or conference is desired. If the switching function supports the consultOptions parameter, the computing function shall provide one of the supported values of this parameter obtained through the capability exchange services. If the switching function requires preallocation of resources to support transfer or conference but is unable to allocate the resources required to support the indicated usage at this time, it shall reject the Alternate Call service request. This parameter does not indicate a restriction or otherwise affect the switching function's capabilities in any way with respect to services other than Transfer or Conference.
4. If all appearances of a shared bridged device configuration are in the hold state and the heldCall parameter contains an appearance's connection ID in the call, then the other appearances in the device configuration will return to the inactive mode (Queued state, Bridged Events).

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAClearCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,System.String)
member.summary: Releases all devices from an existing call.
member.param: The connection to be cleared.
Specifies the user data to be sent to parties in the call.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
In the case of a conference call, this results in all devices in the conference call being released from the call.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1(Any non-Null state)Null, Failed (see item # 1)
D2C2(Any non-Null state)Null, Failed (see item # 1)
D3C1(Any non-Null state)Null, Failed (see item # 1)
1. A connection may transition to the Failed state prior to Null if the device stays off-hook and receives busy or blocked tone. The time between the state transition of Failed --> Null is device and switching function specific and the time may be substantial. Note that the service is completed when all connections transit to either the Null or the Failed state.
Event Sequences:
1. For device-type monitors, it is always guaranteed that the Connection Cleared event associated with the monitored device is provided, and that this is the last Connection Cleared event for the cleared call over the monitor. Depending on how the switching function processes the service request, Connection Cleared events for the other devices in the call may precede this last Connection Cleared event.
2. The exact sequence of the Connection Cleared events for this service is not specified. This is due to the fact that when multiple devices are removed from a call as a result of the service, each switching function may process the clearing of those devices in a different order.
3. If a device stays off-hook and receives busy or blocked tone, the switching function sends the Failed event (event cause of Blocked or Busy) to indicate the status of the device, followed by a Connection Cleared event. The time between the generation of the Failed event and the Connection Cleared event is device and switching function specific and the time may be substantial. As for generation of the Failed event for a given monitor and device in the call, it follows the same conditions as the Connection Cleared events (if the event is supported by the switching function): No events reporting connection transitions for other devices in the call will be sent. However, the Connection Cleared event for the given monitor will be sent (and will be the last event associated with the cleared call sent over that monitor) when the connection transits to Null.
Functional Requirements: 1. The Clear Call service shall only affect the callToBeCleared ConnectionID's call. Other calls that exist at the callToBeCleared ConnectionID's device remain unaffected.
2. The connection ID provided in the request may consist of only a callID portion. This is an exception to the rule of not providing deviceIDs in connectionIDs of service requests.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAAnswerCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID)
member.summary: Connects an alerting or queued call.
member.param: Specifies the connection to be answered.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
This service is typically associated with devices that have attached speakerphone units and headset telephones to connect to a call via hands-free operation. For example, when the call is answered, one of the following actions may occur:
If the specified device has a speaker and a microphone, the speaker and microphone are turned on.
If the specified device only has a speaker, the speaker is turned on. The handset shall be picked up in order to have a two way conversation.
If there is no speaker, then the handset shall be picked up in order to have a two-way conversation.
If the specified device has a headset, the headset is turned on.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (callToBeAnswered)Alerting, Initiated, or QueuedConnected
other connections (i.e., D2C1)(Unspecified)(Unaffected; no transition due to this service).
Event Sequences:
Functional Requirements: 1. If the computing function wants to clear an active call prior to answering an alerting or queued call for a device, it shall first issue a Clear Connection service for the active call and then issue the Answer Call service for the alerting or queued call.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAMakeCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTADeviceID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTADeviceID,System.String)
member.summary: Sets up a call between a calling device and a called device.
member.param:
Specifies the calling/originating device.
Note that this device may be a device that represents a group of devices. In this case the callingDevice in the service request is different from the actual calling device.
Specifies the called device.
Specifies the user data to be sent to parties in the call.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
The service creates a new call and establishes an initiated or connected connection with the calling device. The Make Call service assigns a ConnectionID to the calling device and returns it in the positive acknowledgement.
In the process of establishing the connection with the calling device, the calling device may be prompted to go offhook (if necessary) and when that device does so, a call to the called device is originated or the calling device is still in the process of dialling the called device.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions (Case A: Complete Dialling Sequence):
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (callingDevice)Null, InitiatedInitiated, Connected
D2C1 (called)NullAlerting, Connected, Queued, Fail, or Null (Null if call moves away from the originally called device [i.e., forwarded]).
Connection State Transitions (Case B: Partial Dialling Sequence):
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (callingDevice)Null, InitiatedInitiated
D2C1 (called)NullConnected, Null
Device-Type Event Sequences:
Call-Type Event Sequences:
Functional Requirements: 1. Prompting of the calling device during the processing of the Make Call service is switching function specific (display flashing, ring pattern, lamp blinking, etc.).
2. If the validation of the Make Call service fails for any reason, the computing function receives a negative acknowledgement, and no valid ConnectionIDs will have been created.
3. If the autoOriginate parameter is supported by the switching function and has a value of "Do Not Prompt" and if the calling device is not capable of automatically answering the device, then the processing of this parameter is switching function dependent.
4. Call Forwarding and Do Not Disturb features for the calling device are not honoured for the call being made. If a switching function supports prompting of the calling device and detects that a feature was activated while processing the Make Call service and this feature cannot be overridden, then the switching function will return a negative acknowledgement.
5. All active features are honoured for the called device.
6. If a Make Call service is issued for a calling device that has a connection in the Initiated state (i.e., the computing function got a Service Initiated event for a phone manually going off-hook), and the switching function can support the issuing of the Make Call service under this condition, then the Connection ID in the positive acknowledgement of the Make Call service will contain the same Connection ID received on the Service Initiated event. If the switching function does not support the Make Call service under this condition, then the service will be rejected with a negative acknowledgement.
7. The calledDirectoryNumber parameter may contain a device identifier of null (a null formatted device identifier) or contain a Diallable Digits format (DD) device identifier that has a partial dialling sequence character (i.e., the ";" character) at the end of it. When this parameter is used in this manner, the computing function is indicating that it wishes to stage the dialling sequence. The completion of the dialling sequence can be accomplished either by entering the rest of the sequence manually at the actual device or the computing function can use the Dial Digits service to complete the sequence. The other types of calledDirectoryNumber parameter shall contain a complete dialling sequence. The switching function may have a timeout period for multi-stage dialling. If the dialling sequence does not complete prior to this timeout, it may either abort the call or attempt to use the digits already dialled and signal that dialling is complete with an originated event.
8. If the Make Call service is used to initiate a multistage dialling sequence, the computing function is signalled to continue the dialling sequence via either the Service Initiated event (i.e., if the calledDirectoryNumber is Null) or the Digits Dialled event (i.e., if the calledDirectoryNumber has a partial dialling sequence character).
9. When prompting a device which has a call appearance, bridged, or hybrid device configuration, only one of the appearances will be delivered the call.
10. The callingDevice parameter in the Make Call service request may represent a group of devices from which the actual calling device is selected. In this case, the callingDevice parameter in subsequent events shall refer to the actual calling device. In addition, the Originated event contains a parameter (originatingDevice) that represents the group of devices (the callingDevice parameter passed in service request).

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAClearConnection(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,System.String)
member.summary: Releases a specific device from a call.
member.param: Specifies the connection to be cleared.
Specifies the user data to be sent to parties in the call.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
In the case of a two-party call, this may result in the call being torn down. In the case of a conference call, this results in the specific party being removed from the conference. This service can also be used to inactivate a bridged appearance.
The Connection ID provided in the request is released.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D3C1 (connectionToBe-Cleared)(Any non-Null state)Failed (See item #1), Held (See item #4), Null, Queued (See item #5)
other Connections in call C1 (i.e., D1C1, D2C1)(Unspecified)Null, Failed (See item #3).
1. A connection may transition to the Failed state prior to Null if the device stays off-hook and receives busy or blocked tone. The time between the state transition of Failed -> Null is device and switching function specific and the time may be substantial.
2. The Clear Connection service is completed when the connectionToBeCleared connection transits to either the Null, Failed, Held, or Queued state.
3. If the call involves only two connections or the call has parties outside the switching sub-domain, the other connection(s) may transition to Null or Failed. If the call involves more than two connections, the other connections remain unaffected.
4. The Held state is valid when a call is "suspended" for a time period prior to going to Null.
5. The Queued state is only valid for a shared bridged device configuration when there are other appearances connected into the call.
Device-Type Monitoring Event Sequences:
Call-Type Monitoring Event Sequences:
1. For call-type monitors, if the connection being cleared is the last connection in the call then the Call Cleared event will be reported.
2. If a device stays off-hook and receives busy or blocked tone, the switching function sends the Failed event (event cause of Blocked or Busy) to indicate the status of the device, followed by a Connection Cleared event. The time between the generation of the Failed event and the Connection Cleared event is device and switching function specific and the time may be substantial.
3. Prior to going to Null, a switching function may "suspend" a cleared connection (and transition the connection to the Held state) for a time period. The time between the generation of the Held event and the Connection Cleared event is device and switching function specific and the time may be substantial.
Functional Requirements: 1. If the call associated with Clear Connection service has multiple devices that are outside the switching subdomain, they may remain connected after this service is complete.
2. When the last connected appearance in a shared bridged device configurations is cleared using the Clear Connection service, all other device configurations appearances are also cleared from the call (i.e., Connection Cleared events).

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAConsultationCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTADeviceID,System.String)
member.summary: Places an existing active call at a device on hold and initiates a new call from the same device.
member.param: Specifies the device to be consulted.
Specifies the active connection.
Specifies the user data to be sent to parties in the call.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
The existing active call may include two or more devices. It can be used to get the initial states for and services to perform a consult conference or consult transfer.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (existingCall)ConnectedHold
D1C2 (initiatedCall)NullInitiated, Connected
D3C2 (consulted device)NullAlerting, Connected, Queued, Fail, or Null (Null if call moves away from the D3 (i.e., forwarded)).
Other connections in call C1 (existingCall) (i.e., D2C1)(Unspecified)(Unaffected; no transition due to this service).
1. When providing a partial dialling sequence (Case B), the connected state, for Device D3, only applies to external outbound calls. It indicates that enough of the dial string has been communicated for the switching function to connect the call to the network interface device that will be associated with the called device in the external network.
Device-Type Monitoring Event Sequences:
Call-Type Monitoring Event Sequences:
Functional Requirements: 1. ASXMLClient does not support the consultOptions parameter.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAConferenceCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID)
member.summary: Conferences an existing held call and another active call at a conferencing device.
member.param: Specifies the held connection.
Specifies the active connection.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
The two calls are merged into a single call and the two connections at the conferencing device are resolved into a single connection. The Connection IDs formerly associated with the conferenced connections are released and a new Connection ID for the resulting connection is created.
The existing held call may consist of two or more devices.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (heldCall)HoldNull
D1C2 (activeCall)ConnectedNull
D2C1 and other connections in call C1(unspecified)Null
D1C3NullConnected
D3C2(unspecified)Null
other connections in call C3Null(Inherited from the corresponding connections in C1 and C2)
1. New ConnectionIDs may be assigned to all devices that remain in the call due to the Conference. The final connection states of the new ConnectionIDs will be inherited from the states of the corresponding original calls, except for the conferencing device.
Event Sequences:
1. For Device-Type Monitoring, a Connection Cleared event will not be seen for the activeCall or heldCall ConnectionIDs. The Conferenced event implies that the connections for these calls at this device are cleared.
2. There are multiple connections affected by this service.
Functional Requirements: 1. The Conference service only affects the two calls specified on the service. If other calls exist at the conferencing device, they remain unaffected.
2. To get the connections for each of the devices to their initial states, the application can:
Use the Consultation Call service () to place a call on hold and place a new call.
Use the Alternate Call service () to place a call on hold and answer an alerting call.
3. The appearances in a shared bridged device configuration are unaffected by this service.
4. The maximum number of devices in a conference is subject to switching function limits. On the AVAYA Definity Switch this value is six.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTATransferCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID)
member.summary: Transfers a call held at a device to an active call at the same device.
member.param: Specifies the held connection.
Specifies the active connection.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
The held and active calls at the transferring device shall be merged into a new call. Also, the Connections of the held and active calls at the transferring device shall become Null and their ConnectionIDs shall be released (i.e., the transferring device is no longer involved with the call).
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (heldCall)Connected, HoldNull
D1C2 (activeCall)Connected, HoldNull
D2C1 and any other connections in call C1(unspecified)Null
D3C2 and any other connections in call C2(unspecified)Null
D3C3 and any other connections in call C3Null(Inherited from the corresponding connection in calls C1 and C2)
Event Sequences:
1. If the transferredTo device was not in the connected state prior to the Transfer Call service, then normal call progress events will flow after the Transferred event. Devices in the original held call will hear the call progress associated with the connection to the transferredTo device.
2. A Connection Cleared Event will not be provided for the activeCall or heldCall ConnectionIDs. The Transferred event implies connection cleared for the transferring device.
3. If the transferring device stays off-hook and receives busy or blocked tone, the switching function may send a Failed event (event cause of Blocked or Busy) for a different call, followed by a Connection Cleared event.
4. There are multiple connections affected by this service.
Functional Requirements: 1. To get the connections for each of the devices to their initial states, the computing function can either:
Use the Consultation Call service () to place a call on hold and place a new call.
Use the Alternate Call service () to place a call on hold and answer an alerting call.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAHoldCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID)
member.summary: Places a active call connection on hold at the same device.
member.param: Specifies the active connection to be held.
member.returns:
Any number greater than 1000 that is returned from the method is considered an invokeID.
If its value is not greater than 1000, it identifies an error. The error number can be casted as the enumeration of
member.remarks:
This service interrupts communication for an existing call at a device.
Positive Acknowledgement:
Negative Acknowledgement:
Connection State Transitions:
ConnectionInitial State (Required)Final State
D1C1 (callToBeHeld)ConnectedHold
other connections in the call (i.e., D2C1)(Unspecified)(Unaffected; no transition due to this service).
Event Sequences:
Functional Requirements: 1. The switching function may have a time-out period for the call once it is held. If the call is not retrieved before the time-out period ends, then the held call may ringback either the holding device or a device predefined by the switching function (such as an attendant console, for example).
2. For Shared Bridged device configurations, when a call is held by an appearance (callToBeHeld) all appearances will transition to the hold state (i.e., Held events with a cause of Normal), except when the call that is being held is part of an Independent Shared Bridged device configuration and the appearance that is holding the call is not the last appearance connected into the call. In this case only the appearance holding the call will transition to the hold state and the other appearances are unaffected. For more information, refer to Annex A.2.3, "Shared-Bridged" of "Services for Computer Supported Telecommunications Applications (CSTA) Phase III" (Standard ECMA-269).
3. As a result of placing a connection associated with a digital data call (if supported by the switching function) on hold, the other calls at the device or device configuration are unrelated with this call.

member.name: M:AgileSoftware.Developer.ASXMLClient.CSTAListenHoldCall(AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,AgileSoftware.Developer.CSTA.CSTAConnectionID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: It allows a client application to prevent a specific party on a call from hearing anything said by another specific party or all other parties on the call.

True - the listening paths of all parites on the call will be held from the subjectConnection party. This prevents the subjectConnection from listening to all other parties on the call. The subjectConnection end point can still talk and be heard by all other connected parties on the call. The selectedParty paramter is igonred.
False - the listening path of the subjectConnection party will be held from the selectedParty party. This prevents the subjectConnection from listening to the selectedParty on the call. The subjectConnection end point can still talk and be heard by all other connected parties on the call. The selectedParty paramter must be specified.
A CSTAConnectionID whose voice will not be heard by the subjectConnection party. If allParites is false, a selectedParty must be specified. If allParties is true, the selectedParty is ignored.

A CSTAConnectionID whose listening path will be retrieved from listen-held by the subjectConnection party. If allParties is false, it must be specified. If allParties is true, this paramter is ignored.

True - the listening paths of all parties on the call will be reconnected from the subjectConnection party. This allows the subjectConnection endpoint to be able to listen to all other parties on the call. The selectedParty parameter is ignored.
False - the listening path of the subjectConnection party will be reconnected from the selectedParty party. This allows the subjectConnection endpoint to be able to listen to selectedParty party. The selectedParty paremeter must be specified.
